title: 103_hr2662
content: The "Business Improvement Act of 1993" establishes business activity targets for small businesses and modifies procurement procedures. Section 8 of the Small Business Act is amended to allow participating agencies to enter into contracts with small businesses owned by disadvantaged individuals using restricted competition or a price preference of up to 10%. The term 'participating agency' excludes the Department of Defense. The Small Business Act is amended to allow agencies to contract with small businesses owned by disadvantaged individuals using restricted competition or a price preference of up to 10%, excluding the Department of Defense. The authority provided in the amendment remains in effect until September 30, 2000. SEC. 4. ELIGIBILITY OF PAST DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM PARTICIPANTS FOR SECTION 8(a) CONTRACT AWARDS. Section (8)(a)(1)(C) of the Small Business Act is amended to allow awarding contracts to small businesses owned and controlled by socially and economically disadvantaged individuals who have completed their Program Participation period as prescribed by section 7(j)(15). Eligibility for contract awards is based on being a Program Participant at the time of contract solicitation for competitive awards or at the time of submitting certifications for sole source awards. The prospective awardee submitted certifications and representations for the contract to the contracting agency. SEC. 5 amends Section 8(a)(1) of the Small Business Act by removing competitive contracts under subparagraph (D). SEC. 6 ensures continued access to business opportunities. Section 8(a)(3) of the Small Business Act is amended to require competitive bidding for contracts to furnish products or services to a participating agency if certain conditions are met. The Small Business Act requires competitive bidding for contracts with participating agencies. Contracts may be restricted to small businesses owned by disadvantaged individuals who have completed a development program. The Small Business Act mandates competitive bidding for contracts with participating agencies, which may be limited to small businesses owned by disadvantaged individuals who have completed a development program. Additionally, a small business concern must subcontract 20-50% of the contract award value to small businesses in the developmental stage of the minority small business and capital ownership development program. The head of a participating agency must ensure that follow-on contracts for the same products or services are awarded under the same authority. The term 'small business' is defined as a business concern with not more than 1500 employees, as per the Small Business Act. SEC. 7. Study of development program participation terms by industry sector; suspension of development program graduations. The Small Business Act is amended to authorize a study on program participation terms by industry sector for small businesses. Additionally, the graduation of small businesses from development programs is suspended. A small business concern participating in a program under the Small Business Act shall be allowed continued participation until final regulations are issued based on a study, or until their eligibility expires as per the Act's requirements. SEC. 8. COMPLIANCE WITH BUY INDIAN ACT. Federal agencies contracting with the Small Business Administration under section 8(a) of the Small Business Act for goods or services from economically disadvantaged Indian tribes are considered compliant with the Buy Indian Act. SEC. 9. UNIFORM PROCEDURES FOR CONTESTING STATUS OF CONCERNS. "Section 16 of the Small Business Act is amended to establish uniform procedures for contesting the status of a concern as a 'small business concern owned and controlled by socially and economically disadvantaged individuals' within 120 days of enactment."
